001package org.postgresql.pljava.example.annotation;
002
003import java.sql.Array;
004import java.sql.ResultSet;
005import java.sql.SQLException;
006
007import org.postgresql.pljava.annotation.Function;
008import org.postgresql.pljava.annotation.SQLAction;
009
010/**
011 * A gnarly test of TupleDesc reference management, crafted by Johann Oskarsson
012 * for bug report 1010962 on pgFoundry.
013 *<p>
014 * This example relies on {@code implementor} tags reflecting the PostgreSQL
015 * version, set up in the {@link ConditionalDDR} example. Before PostgreSQL 8.4,
016 * there is no array of {@code RECORD}, which this test requires.
017 */
018@SQLAction(requires="1010962 func", implementor="postgresql_ge_80400",
019    install={
020        "CREATE TYPE javatest.B1010962 AS ( b1_val float8, b2_val int)",
021
022        "CREATE TYPE javatest.C1010962 AS ( c1_val float8, c2_val float8)",
023
024        "CREATE TYPE javatest.A1010962 as (" +
025        " b B1010962," +
026        " c C1010962," +
027        " a_val int" +
028        ")",
029
030        "SELECT javatest.complexParam(array_agg(" +
031        " CAST(" +
032        "  (" +
033        "   CAST((0.1, i)    AS javatest.B1010962)," +
034        "   CAST((0.1, 10/i) AS javatest.C1010962)," +
035        "   i" +
036        "  ) AS javatest.A1010962)" +
037        " ))" +
038        " FROM generate_series (1,10) i"
039    },
040    remove={
041        "DROP TYPE javatest.A1010962",
042        "DROP TYPE javatest.C1010962",
043        "DROP TYPE javatest.B1010962"
044    }
045)
046public class PGF1010962
047{
048    /**
049     * Test for bug 1010962: pass in an array of A1010962, expect no
050     * TupleDesc reference leak warnings.
051     * @param receiver Looks polymorphic, but expects an array of A1010962
052     * @return 0
053     */
054    @Function(schema="javatest", provides="1010962 func",
055                implementor="postgresql_ge_80400")
056    public static int complexParam( ResultSet receiver[] )
057    throws SQLException
058    {
059        for ( int i = 0; i < receiver.length; i++ )
060        {
061            ResultSet b = (ResultSet)receiver[ i ].getObject( 1 );
062            double b1_val = b.getDouble( 1 );
063            int b2_val = b.getInt( 2 );
064
065            ResultSet c = (ResultSet)receiver[ i ].getObject( 2 );
066            double c1_val = c.getDouble( 1 );
067            double c2_val = c.getDouble( 2 );
068
069            int a = receiver[ i ].getInt( 3 );
070        }
071
072        return 0;
073    }
074}
